Angelic Chorus.name: Angelic Chorus
Angelic Chorus.publicNotes: While choral angels are content to sing their hymns in Nirvana, they must sometimes take to the mortal realm to provide needed succor for those engaged in righteous battle against the wicked. An angelic chorus often acts as support for armies who have gained the favor of the celestial realms.

action->Admonishing Hymn.description: The angelic choir raises their voices in song, singing a note that vibrates the very fabric of being. action->Harmonized Spellcasting.description: When the angelic chorus Casts a Spell, their constituent members combine their efforts into casting a more powerful version of the spell than any one member could achieve alone. Animated Army.name: Animated Army
Animated Army.publicNotes: Animated statues usually appear in pairs or alone, hiding in plain sight among the other decor. Occasionally, a creator will fashion dozens of animated statues to serve as a nigh-unstoppable fighting force that doesn't complain or tire.
Animated Army.hpDetails: (4 segments); Thresholds 120 (4 segments); Thresholds 80 (3 segments), 40 (2 segments)

action->Construct Armor.description: Like normal objects, the animated statues of the animated army have Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage the animated army takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an animated army is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 23.

Apprentice Magician Clique.name: Apprentice Magician Clique
Apprentice Magician Clique.publicNotes: Students at academies that teach magic sometimes form fast friendships. When not studying or blowing off steam together, these cliques might be called to defend their place of learning from outside attack.

action->Barrage of Force.name: Barrage of Force
action->Barrage of Force.description: The apprentice magicians launch shards of pure magic at all creatures in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 120 feet. This barrage deals @Damage[5d4[force]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic] save). When the clique is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].

action->Clique Spellcasting.name: Clique Spellcasting
action->Clique Spellcasting.description: When the apprentice magician clique Casts a Spell, its members pool their arcane power into the spell. A creature who critically fails their save against the spell or whom the clique hits with a critical spell attack is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute.

action->Sparking Wands.name: Sparking Wands
action->Sparking Wands.description:
Frequency once per round

1 @Damage[1d8[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d8+3)[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(2d8+7)[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage

Arboreal Copse.name: Arboreal Copse
Arboreal Copse.publicNotes: Though arboreal wardens typically remain within the boundaries of the forests they protect, they occasionally gather into copses to seek information about potential threats to report back to arboreal regents. Arboreals are typically slow to act, but copses must sometimes make quick judgment calls when faced with imminent dangers.

action->Reactive Attack.name: Reactive Attack
action->Reactive Attack.description:
Trigger An enemy within 5 feet of the arboreal copse uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The arboreals swing their stone swords. The triggering enemy takes @Damage[(2d8+9)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save). If the creature critically fails their saving throw and the trigger was a manipulate action, the troop disrupts that action.

action->Raise Shields.name: Raise Shields
action->Raise Shields.description: The arboreal wardens of the copse raise their shields in tandem, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC and Reflex saves.

action->Shoving Shield Wall.name: Shoving Shield Wall
action->Shoving Shield Wall.description: The arboreal copse Strides. All enemies whose square the copse begins in or passes through during their movement take @Damage[5d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic||options:area-effect|inflicts:forced-movement]). action->Sword Bash.name: Sword Bash

Archer Regiment.name: Archer Regiment
Archer Regiment.publicNotes: Archer regiments are capable of filling the sky with arrows at great distances, making them vital to any war leader who wishes to weaken the enemy before they get close to allied units or encampments.

action->Dagger Defense.name: Dagger Defense
action->Dagger Defense.description:
The archer regiment draws daggers to attack close-range enemies. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions. The archer regiment gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the beginning of their next turn.

1 @Damage[(2d4+2)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(4d4+12)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(4d4+15)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

action->Drilled in Formations.name: Drilled in Formations
action->Drilled in Formations.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The archer regiment uses @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.USyDPcSdzcm024zT]{Change Formation}. An archer regiment unit typically knows the loose and marching column formations.

action->Rain of Arrows.name: Rain of Arrows
action->Rain of Arrows.description: The archer regiment fires their longbows in a coordinated volley. This volley is either a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] within 200 feet that deals @Damage[4d8[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage or a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 100 feet that deals @Damage[6d8[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage. Either effect has a @Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect] save. When the archer regiment is reduced to 2 segments, both areas are reduced by 5 feet.

Archon Bastion.name: Archon Bastion
Archon Bastion.publicNotes: Rekheps, also known as shield archons, stand against any fiendish onslaughts on Heaven, but occasionally travel to the mortal Universe to protect the weak. Large formations of rekheps are a sight to behold as they lock their shield forms in place to face the wicked.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Archon's Aegis.name: Archon's Aegis
action->Archon's Aegis.description:

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.w74r3xO0rsowT5ra]{Effect: Archon's Aegis}

action->Fearless Switch.name: Fearless Switch
action->Fearless Switch.description: The archon bastion Strides so that at least one of its segments occupies the same space of a Large or smaller willing ally. That willing ally is then teleported to any open space it can fit into that is adjacent to any of the archon bastion's segments, using teleportation magic innate to the troop's individual shield archons. The archon bastion can move up to three allies in this fashion.

action->Living Shields.name: Living Shields
action->Living Shields.description:
The archon bastion grants each ally within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until that ally is no longer within the area or until the start of the archon bastion's next turn, whichever comes first. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.NXnngvaJXHtskVjU]{Effect: Living Shields}

Boggard Dreadknot.name: Boggard Dreadknot
Boggard Dreadknot.publicNotes: The boggard cavalry wields clubs as they ride giant frogs into battle, often ranging out of their swamp homelands to strike fear into the hearts of their enemies.

action->Batrachian Blitz.name: Batrachian Blitz
action->Batrachian Blitz.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The boggard dreadknot pummels each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] with their clubs, with a @Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage dealt depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[2d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(3d6+10)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(4d6+13)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

action->Javelin Barrage.name: Javelin Barrage
action->Javelin Barrage.description: The dreadknot draws javelins and launches a coordinated barrage. This barrage is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 30 feet that deals @Damage[4d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect] save). When the dreadknot is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].

action->Mounted Troop.name: Mounted Troop
action->Mounted Troop.description: Effects that target only animals or only humanoids may not work on the boggard dreadknot, subject to the GM's discretion.

action->Swamp Passage.name: Swamp Passage
action->Swamp Passage.description: A boggard dreadknot ignores difficult terrain caused by swamp terrain features.

action->Tongue Lashing.name: Tongue Lashing
action->Tongue Lashing.description: The dreadknot's giant frogs lash out at each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15] with their tongues, requiring them to succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. A creature grabbed in this way isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but it can't move more than 15 feet from the dreadknot. action->Sling Barrage.description: The dreadknot draws and loads slings to launch a coordinated barrage. This barrage is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 50 feet that deals @Damage[3d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). When the scouting party is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].

action->Swamp Passage.name: Swamp Passage
action->Swamp Passage.description: A boggard scouting party ignores difficult terrain caused by swamp terrain features.

Charau-ka Shrieker Crew.name: Charau-ka Shrieker Crew
Charau-ka Shrieker Crew.publicNotes: Charau-ka are small humanoid apes who live in tropical jungles, especially within the Mwangi Expanse. Shrieker crews patrol the canopies close to charau-ka settlements, keeping predators at bay. Sometimes, a group of charau-ka will devote themselves to the demon lord Angazhan and become a bloodthirsty hunting party.

action->Frenzied Hatchets.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The charau-ka engage in a coordinated melee attack against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

action->Shrieking Charge.description: With raucous shrieks, the shrieker crew charges forward. The troop Strides twice. The range increases by 15 feet if the charau-ka are above their targets. When the shrieker crew is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].

Clockwork Infantry.name: Clockwork Infantry
Clockwork Infantry.publicNotes: With each unit being 500 pounds of metal and magic, a clockwork infantry is a force to be reckoned with on the battlefield. Needing no food, shelter, or rest and feeling no pain, clockwork infantry can advance where living units have great trouble. With no morale that can be broken or minds that can be beguiled, they patrol without stopping and show no mercy. The only drawback is the need to wind them more often than simpler clockwork mechanics.

action->Wind-Up.name: Wind-Up
action->Wind-Up.description:
24 hours, [[/act disable-device dc=27]], standy

For a clockwork to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for the listed amount of time, usually 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. Some clockworks' abilities require them to spend some of their remaining operational time. They can't spend more than they have and shut down immediately once they have 0 time remaining. If it's unclear when a clockwork was last wound, most clockwork keepers wind all their clockworks at a set time, typically 8 a.m.

A clockwork that lists standby in its wind-up entry can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).

A creature can attempt to Disable a Device to wind a clockwork down (with a DC listed in the wind-up entry). For each success, the clockwork loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the clockwork is in standby mode.

action->Reactive Sweep.name: Reactive Sweep
action->Reactive Sweep.description:

Effect The clockwork soldiers of the infantry extend external plates on mechanical actuators to defend the troop or an adjacent creature. The creature gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of the infantry's next turn, or until it is no longer adjacent to the infantry, whichever comes first.

Clockwork Runner Pack.publicNotes: Clockwork runners are units build for speed. Mimicking large cats, they sacrifice sturdiness for agility. Runners provide excellent battlefield control by speedily traversing diverse terrain types, able to cut off enemy units and provide covering fire for allies with their built-in crossbows. As clockworks, they do need to be rewound, making them less ideal for longer deployments.

action->War Pounce.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The clockwork runner pack Strides, ignoring difficult terrain (but not greater difficult terrain). At the end of this movement, each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] takes @Damage[1d8[untyped]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic] save).

Deinonychus Pack.name: Deinonychus Pack
Deinonychus Pack.publicNotes: Deinonychuses are widely known and feared both for the razor-sharp claws with which they savagely disembowel their prey and for their unmatched mastery of pack tactics, which enables determined deinonychus packs to consistently bring down prey much larger than themselves. Some iruxi and xulgath communities train these dinosaurs to act as battlefield skirmishers, weakening their enemies with hit-and-run tactics before closing in for the kill.

Frequency once per round

Effect The pack makes a melee attack against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

2 @Damage[(2d6+4)[piercing],2d4[persistent,bleed]|options:area-damage] damage

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3} (1 round)

Stage 4 as Stage 3 and permanently forget the last hour (1 round)

action->Root.name: Root
action->Root.description: Until the next time it acts, the dezullon thicket appears to be a field of normal pitcher plants. It has an automatic result of 49 (53 in forests or swamps) on Deception checks and DCs to pass as a grove of non-creature plants.

action->Thrashing Vines.name: Thrashing Vines
action->Thrashing Vines.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The thicket makes a melee attack against each enemy within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:33|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d8+3)[bludgeoning],1d6[acid]|options:area-damage]{1d8+3 bludgeoning plus 1d6 acid}

2 @Damage[(2d8+11)[bludgeoning],2d6[acid]|options:area-damage,mass-improved-grab]{2d8+11 bludgeoning plus 2d6 acid} and Mass Improved Grab

3 @Damage[(3d8+12)[bludgeoning],3d6[acid]|options:area-damage,mass-improved-grab]{3d8+12 bludgeoning plus 3d6 acid} and Mass Improved Grab

action->Mass Improved Grab.name: Mass Improved Grab
action->Mass Improved Grab.description:
Trigger A creature fails or critically fails their Reflex save against the dezullon thicket's Thrashing Vines

Effect The dezullon thicket attempts an Athletics check to [[/act grapple]] the triggering creature. A dezullon thicket can Grapple as many creatures as it has remaining segments, though it needs to spend an action to extend the duration on subsequent rounds. These attempts neither apply nor count toward the creature's multiple attack penalty.

Drake Flight.name: Drake Flight
Drake Flight.publicNotes: Though drakes from different biomes rarely interact with one another due to geographical distance, a powerful creature, ancient artifact, or natural catastrophe could bring together multiple types of drakes into a single terrifying, living catastrophe. Such a flight can be a terror to behold on the battlefield.

action->Draconic Onslaught.name: Draconic Onslaught
action->Draconic Onslaught.description:
The drakes frenzy, lashing out with fangs and tails. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] attempts a @Check[reflex|dc:30|basic] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[2d8[untyped]] damage

2 @Damage[(3d8+10)[untyped]] damage

3 @Damage[(4d8+14)[untyped]] damage

action->Drake Breath.name: Drake Breath
action->Drake Breath.description: Certain drakes within the flight bring their breath weapon (or similar ability) to bear, exhaling energy that explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] within 120 feet. This explosion deals @Damage[5d6[untyped]] damage (acid, cold, fire, or poison damage); the ability gains the corresponding trait. The drake flight can't choose the same damage type until it uses this ability with a different damage type. When the drakes are reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:10].

action->Speed Surge.name: Speed Surge
action->Speed Surge.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The drake flight Strides or Flies twice.

Dromaar Company.name: Dromaar Company
Dromaar Company.publicNotes: Numerous dromaar mercenary companies operate in and around Belkzen, providing their strength at arms to any hold that requests their services. These disciplined warriors march confidently into battle, bringing their axes to bear against all who stand in their way.

action->Bola Hurl.name: Bola Hurl
action->Bola Hurl.description: The dromaars draw bolas and toss them in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15]. Each creature in this area takes @Damage[3d6[bludgeoning]|traits:nonlethal|options:area-damage]{3d6 nonlethal bludgeoning} damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). A creature who fails this saving throw is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

action->Charge the Fallen.name: Charge the Fallen
action->Charge the Fallen.description: The dromaar company Strides up to twice, sweeping with their axes. They deal @Damage[(2d8+5)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save) to each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] at the end of their movement. This damage increases by 5 if the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

action->Disciplined Strikes.name: Disciplined Strikes
action->Disciplined Strikes.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The dromaars coordinate melee attacks with their axes against all enemies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d8[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d8+5)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(2d8+10)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

Druid Circle.name: Druid Circle
Druid Circle.publicNotes: In their role as protectors of the wild and unspoiled areas of the world, powerful druids might gather together to stand against a particularly heinous threat.

action->Call Down the Storm.name: Call Down the Storm
action->Call Down the Storm.description: The druids summon wind and lightning against all creatures in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 80 feet. This storm deals @Damage[3d10[electricity]|options:area-damage|inflicts:forced-movement] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect] save). A creature who fails the save is also pushed 5 feet away from the druid circle. When the druid circle is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].

action->Sickle and Staff.name: Sickle and Staff
action->Sickle and Staff.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The druids strike out in a coordinated melee attack against all enemies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] with a @Check[reflex|dc:29|basic] save. The damage dealt depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[2d6[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(4d6+9)[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(5d6+13)[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage

action->Troop Spellcasting.name: Troop Spellcasting
action->Troop Spellcasting.description: When the druid circle Casts a Spell, its constituent members combine their efforts into casting a more powerful version of the spell than any one member could achieve alone. When Casting a Spell that has an area of a burst, cone, or line and doesn't have a duration, increase the area of that spell. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius is not affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet long or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

Dwarf Longshot Squad.name: Dwarf Longshot Squad
Dwarf Longshot Squad.publicNotes: While many dwarves train to master hammers and shields, others seek to become masters of ranged weapons, usually sturdy and dwarven-built crossbows. Dwarven armies employ longshot squads as the first line of defense, especially outside of cramped tunnels and subterranean caverns.

action->Bolts from the Blue.name: Bolts from the Blue
action->Bolts from the Blue.description: The dwarven longshots reload their crossbows, then launch a ranged attack in the form of a volley. This volley is a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] within 120 feet that deals @Damage[6d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect] saving throw. When the dwarven longshot squad is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:10].

action->Brandish Bayonets!.name: Brandish Bayonets!
action->Brandish Bayonets!.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Using blades attached to their crossbows, the dwarven longshots engages in a coordinated melee attack against enemies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], with a @Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d8+2)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d8+11)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(3d8+13)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

action->Hampering Fusillade.name: Hampering Fusillade
action->Hampering Fusillade.description:
The dwarven longshots fire dozens of bolts in quick succession to slow down advancing enemies. Each creature in a @Template[type:burst|distance:30] within 120 feet must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speed for 1 minute. Spending an Interact action to remove the bolts ends this penalty.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.3bAtqn2WPSqxCYPY]{Effect: Hampering Fusillade}

Dwarf Longshot Squad (Guns).name: Dwarf Longshot Squad (Guns)
Dwarf Longshot Squad (Guns).publicNotes:
While many dwarves train to master hammers and shields, others seek to become masters of ranged weapons, usually sturdy and dwarven-built crossbows. Dwarven armies employ longshot squads as the first line of defense, especially outside of cramped tunnels and subterranean caverns.

Longshot with Guns

Dwarves from Dongun Hold and similar places have access to firearms, and you might choose to reflect this by giving the dwarf longshot squad rifles. Adjust the stat block to have the uncommon trait and replace mentions of "crossbows" to "rifles" and "bolts" to "bullets." In addition, give the Bolts from the Blue action the concussive trait, meaning that it deals bludgeoning or piercing damage, whichever would be more detrimental to each target (you may also want to refer to it as "Bullets from the Blue"). Finally, replace Hampering Fusillade with the following ability.

Bullet Smog 2 The dwarven longshots fire their rifles in rapid succession to create a cloud of smoke within 120 feet. When the dwarven longshot squad is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:10].

First-Class Infantry.name: First-Class Infantry
First-Class Infantry.publicNotes: Soldiers who participate in multiple campaigns of war gain the experience necessary to become their military's finest fighting forces. First-class infantry troops are deployed on battlefields where winning the day is of the utmost importance.

action->No Retreat.name: No Retreat
action->No Retreat.description: These soldiers have been extensively trained to hold their ground no matter the situation. If any effect would force the first-class infantry to move, reduce the distance by 10 feet. Any time they would be affected by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, the first-class infantry is instead @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for the same duration.

action->Bolt Salvo.name: Bolt Salvo
action->Bolt Salvo.description: The first-class infantry draws, loads, and shoots a salvo from their crossbows. The salvo is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 120 feet that deals @Damage[4d8[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic|options:area-effect] save). When the first-class infantry is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].

action->Clash of Steel.name: Clash of Steel
action->Clash of Steel.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The first-class infantry attacks each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], with a @Check[reflex|dc:29|basic] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(2d6+1)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(4d6+10)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(4d6+18)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

action->Drilled in Formations.name: Drilled in Formations
action->Drilled in Formations.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The first-class infantry uses @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.USyDPcSdzcm024zT]{Change Formation}. An first-class infantry unit typically knows the marching column and wedge formations.

action->First-class Charge.name: First-class Charge
action->First-class Charge.description: The first-class infantry rushes forward with a hunger for battle. They Stride up to twice their Speed. At the end of their movement, each enemy within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] takes @Damage[(2d6+5)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage, with a @Check[reflex|dc:30|basic|options:area-effect] save.

action->Brutal Retaliation.name: Brutal Retaliation
action->Brutal Retaliation.description:
Trigger The fleshwarp amalgam loses a segment due to passing a Hit Point threshold

Effect The fleshwarp amalgam lashes out in retaliation. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] takes @Damage[2d10+6[untyped]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic|inflicts:forced-movement]). A creature who fails the save is also pushed 5 feet away from the amalgam.

action->Acid Spray.name: Acid Spray
action->Acid Spray.description: The fleshwarp amalgam sprays acid from their various orifices, combining the streams into a powerful spray. This acid spray is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] that deals @Damage[3d8[acid]|options:area-damage|options:area-effect] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic] save) within 60 feet. A creature who critically fails their saving throw takes @Damage[1d8[persistent,acid]|options:area-damage] damage. When the troop is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].

action->Frenzy of Tentacles and Claws.name: Frenzy of Tentacles and Claws
action->Frenzy of Tentacles and Claws.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The fleshwarps make wild melee attacks against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d10[untyped]] damage

2 @Damage[(2d10+6)[untyped]] damage

3 @Damage[(2d10+11)[untyped]] damage

action->Many-Limbed Stride.name: Many-Limbed Stride
action->Many-Limbed Stride.description: While moving on land, the fleshwarp amalgam ignores the effects of non-magical difficult terrain.

Gargoyle Wing.name: Gargoyle Wing
Gargoyle Wing.publicNotes: Normally solitary beasts that lurk in abandoned temples and other structures that afford them a place to hide among appropriately monstrous statuary, gargoyles occasionally band together to hunt challenging prey or simply to take communal pleasure in slaughtering the defenseless. Called wings, these groupings are usually short-lived, though that matters little to those who fall victim to their predations in the meantime.

action->Death From Above.name: Death From Above
action->Death From Above.description:
Trigger The gargoyle wing is Flying, and a creature moves into an adjacent square below it

Effect The gargoyle wing swoops down with their talons. The triggering creature takes @Damage[(2d8+9)[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save).

action->Catch and Release.name: Catch and Release
action->Catch and Release.description: The gargoyle wing attempts an Athletics checks to [[/act grapple]], comparing the result to the Fortitude DC of a number of Large or smaller creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] equal to the gargoyle wing's remaining number of segments, then Flies up to 40 feet, bringing any successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} creatures along, and Releases them.

action->Raking Swoop.name: Raking Swoop
action->Raking Swoop.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The gargoyle wing rips and tears with their stony talons at each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage dealt depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d8+2)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d8+9)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(3d8+11)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

Giant Ant Army.name: Giant Ant Army
Giant Ant Army.publicNotes: Like their tiny counterparts, colonies of giant ants often form vast armies that launch regular campaigns into the lands surrounding their nests to forage for food and expand their territory. Though their primary targets are usually rival colonies, a giant ant army that happens upon a humanoid settlement will not hesitate to overrun and strip it of resources to bring back to their queen, taking a particular interest in the settlement's former inhabitants.

action->Giant Ant Venom.name: Giant Ant Venom
action->Giant Ant Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:24]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d10[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} (1 round)

action->Grasping Mandibles.name: Grasping Mandibles
action->Grasping Mandibles.description:
Requirements The giant ant army's last action was a Mandible Frenzy that at least one creature failed their save against or the giant ant army has at least one creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect If used after Grasping Mandibles, the giant ant army can attempt an Athletics check to [[/act grapple]], comparing the result to the Fortitude DC of each creature who failed its saving throw, up to as many creatures as the giant ant army has remaining segments. The giant any army can instead use Grasping Mandibles to choose one creature it's grabbing or restraining to automatically extend that condition to the end of the army's next turn.

action->Haul Away.name: Haul Away
action->Haul Away.description:
Requirements The giant ant army has at least one creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect The army Strides up to its Speed, carrying any restrained creatures with it. If the creature is Gargantuan, the giant ant army is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7]{Encumbered}.

action->Mandible Frenzy.name: Mandible Frenzy
action->Mandible Frenzy.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The army makes a savage bite attack against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save). The damage dealt depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d8[slashing]|options:area-damage,grasping-mandibles] damage plus Grasping Mandibles

2 @Damage[(2d8+6)[slashing]|options:area-damage,grasping-mandibles] damage plus Grasping Mandibles

3 @Damage[(2d8+11)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

action->Overwhelm.name: Overwhelm
action->Overwhelm.description: The giant ant army swarms over a Large or larger creature that it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, pinning the creature in place and causing it to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} until the start of the giant ant army's next turn or until it Escapes. A creature that begins its turn restrained by the army is repeatedly stung by the clinging ants, automatically taking @Damage[2d6[piercing]] damage and suffering the effects of giant ant venom.

Gnome Cannon Corps.name: Gnome Cannon Corps
Gnome Cannon Corps.publicNotes: Inventive gnomes blend engineering and fey magic to create wondrous cannons, whose colorful blasts dazzle foes while creating areas of warped terrain. Only the cleverest generals understand how to use cannon corps to great advantage in unconventional warfare.

action->Arcane Explosion.name: Arcane Explosion
action->Arcane Explosion.description: Aiming the gnome cannons toward the enemy, loading them, and firing them requires the troop's full attention. The cannons fire a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] of bright magic within 200 feet that deals @Damage[(2d12+2)[force]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect,light,visual] save). A creature that fails their save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round; this is a light and visual effect. The area of the explosion seems to twist and ripple for 1 minute afterward. A creature that attempts to move through the space must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:22] save or treat the area as difficult terrain; this is an illusion and visual effect.

action->Cannon Vent.name: Cannon Vent
action->Cannon Vent.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The gnome engineers vent the cannons' energy in a blast that hits all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d6+2)[fire]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d6+8)[fire]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(3d6+10)[fire]|options:area-damage] damage

action->Direct Hit.name: Direct Hit
action->Direct Hit.description: The gnomes fire a more mundane round from one of their cannons at a single target within 60 feet, who takes @Damage[(3d10+6)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|inflicts:forced-movement] save). On a failed save, the creature is also pushed 5 feet away from the troop.

Goblin Rabble.name: Goblin Rabble
Goblin Rabble.publicNotes: Goblins lack the organization and discipline of their hobgoblin cousins but often more than make up for it with guile. Some goblin tribes like to terrorize trade routes under the cover of dusk. Focused on stripping valuables and escaping rather than finishing a fight, these groups of goblins excel at speed and identifying things of value to strip from their bewildered prey, using hit-and-run tactics since they tend to be outmatched more often than not.

action->Dogpile.name: Dogpile
action->Dogpile.description:
The goblin rabble engage in as coordinated an attack as they can with their dogslicers, attacking each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:prone] save). The damage depends on the number of actions. A creature who critically fails their save is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

1 @Damage[1d6[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d6+4)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(2d6+7)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

action->Hobble Pursuit.name: Hobble Pursuit
action->Hobble Pursuit.description:
The goblin rabble hamstring and hobble as many enemies as possible. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:18] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes a –5-foot circumstance penalty to their Speeds.

Failure The creature takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to their Speeds and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Critical Failure The creature takes a –15-foot circumstance penalty to their Speeds and is slowed 1.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.lvK0DAuTYOnT6E5f]{Effect: Hobble Pursuit}

action->Rush and Steal.name: Rush and Steal
action->Rush and Steal.description: Quickly moving in with grasping hands, the goblin rabble take what they can. The goblin rabble Strides up to twice their Speed. During this movement, the goblins Interact to pick up an unattended object no larger than 2 Bulk or attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} an item from a creature they are adjacent to; the goblins can pick up or Steal as many objects as they have remaining segments in any combination.

action->Bad Deal.name: Bad Deal
action->Bad Deal.description:
The halflings mock and taunt their enemies with quick Harrow readings that predict doom. The troop chooses a number of creatures equal to the number of its remaining segments within 60 feet. Each target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:23] save. On a failure, the target must roll their next attack roll, saving throw, or skill check twice and use the worse result.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.U37oY6akeNfTtgLk]{Effect: Bad Deal}

action->False Cuts.name: False Cuts
action->False Cuts.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The halflings feint with their cards and then lash out with their daggers in a coordinated melee attack against enemies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], with a @Check[reflex|dc:23|basic] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d4[piercing],1d4[precision]] precision damage

2 @Damage[(2d4+7)[piercing],2d4[precision]] precision damage

3 @Damage[(3d4+10)[piercing],2d4[precision]] precision damage

action->Troop Harrowing.name: Troop Harrowing
action->Troop Harrowing.description:
When the halfling lucky draw Casts a Spell that targets a single creature, some of the constituent members can perform a focused Harrow reading on the target as part of Casting the Spell. The lucky draw attempts an @Check[occultism|against:will] skill check against the target's Will DC. On a success, the target takes a –1 status penalty to their saving throw or AC against the spell (–2 on a critical success). If the lucky draw critically fails this check, their reading portends bad news for the halflings and they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.GZAVAOj0s73Swc0e]{Effect: Troop Harrowing}

Hell Hound Pack.name: Hell Hound Pack
Hell Hound Pack.publicNotes: Frequently deployed on the battlefield alongside vordine legions, hell hound packs distract and weaken enemy forces to provide their masters with a tactical advantage. While not intelligent enough to employ advanced maneuvers, well-trained hell hounds are adept at using their flaming breath to control the battlefield by separating enemy units from their allies or forcing them into less favorable positions, leaving them easy prey for other fiendish troops.

action->Hellish Revenge.name: Hellish Revenge
action->Hellish Revenge.description:
Trigger The hell hound pack is critically hit by a Strike or spell attack

Effect The hell hound pack's Hellfire Breath recharges. They can immediately use it as part of this reaction.

action->Hellfire Breath.name: Hellfire Breath
action->Hellfire Breath.description: The hell hounds in the pack combine their efforts to bathe the battlefield in hellish flame, dealing @Damage[2d10[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to all creatures in two @Template[type:cone|distance:15]s (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect] save) that can't overlap. The hell hound pack can't use Hellfire Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Hellfire Breath]]{1d4 rounds}. If the pack would take fire damage or be targeted by a fire effect, its Hellfire Breath recharges.

action->Infernal Mauling.name: Infernal Mauling
action->Infernal Mauling.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The pack tears into each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] with their flaming jaws (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic] save). The damage dealt depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d4[piercing],1d6[fire]|options:area-damage]{1d4 piercing damage plus 1d6 fire damage}

2 @Damage[(1d8+7)[piercing],2d6[fire]|options:area-damage]{1d8+7 piercing damage plus 2d6 fire damage}

3 @Damage[(2d8+7)[piercing],2d6[fire]|options:area-damage]{2d8+7 piercing damage plus 2d6 fire damage}

Hobgoblin Veteran Regiment.name: Hobgoblin Veteran Regiment
Hobgoblin Veteran Regiment.publicNotes: There are few sights as intimidating as a regiment of well-armed hobgoblin soldiers advancing across a battlefield. Exceptionally capable of defending themselves and tenacious to a fault, such hobgoblins are used as a precision tool, exploiting the enemy's weakest point and tearing it wide open to collapse entire defensive lines.

action->Hobgoblin Phalanx.name: Hobgoblin Phalanx
action->Hobgoblin Phalanx.description: Many of the hobgoblins raise their shields to protect their allies. The regiment gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of their next turn.

action->Watchful.name: Watchful
action->Watchful.description: The hobgoblin regiment is trained to guard from all sides with shields at the ready. The hobgoblin regiment can't be made @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} by flanking creatures of the troop's level or lower.

action->Disciplined Strikes.name: Disciplined Strikes
action->Disciplined Strikes.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The hobgoblins engage in a coordinated melee attack against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], with a @Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d8+2)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d8+9)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(3d8+11)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

action->Overrun.name: Overrun
action->Overrun.description: The hobgoblin veteran regiment marches inexorably forward, crushing enemies in their path. The regiment Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of Large or smaller creatures, dealing @Damage[(2d8+9)[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save) to each creature whose space it enters. The regiment can attempt to Overrun the same creature only once in a single use of Overrun. When the regiment is reduced to 2 segments, the damage decreases to @Damage[(1d8+2)[slashing]] damage.

action->Shortbow Volley.name: Shortbow Volley
action->Shortbow Volley.description: The hobgoblins draw their shortbows, then launch a ranged attack in the form of a volley. This volley is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 60 feet that deals @Damage[4d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save. When the regiment is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].

Kobold Trap Squad.name: Kobold Trap Squad
Kobold Trap Squad.publicNotes: Kobold trap squads generally protect their warrens, but these groups sometimes range outside of their lairs at the behest of a powerful patron. Their goals are usually to scout a given location, but they can be tasked with procuring an item or resource for the good of the warren.

action->Group Scamper.name: Group Scamper
action->Group Scamper.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The kobolds Stride up to their Speed plus 5 feet and gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. If they end this movement with at least 1 segment adjacent to any enemy, the squad is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the beginning of its next turn.

action->Hasty Traps.name: Hasty Traps
action->Hasty Traps.description:
The kobolds hastily prepare a handful of rudimentary traps in their vicinity until the beginning of their next turn. The next creature who moves adjacent to the trap squad triggers a trap and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:18] save. On a failure, the creature takes @Damage[1d4[persistent,bleed]] damage (@Damage[2d4[persistent,bleed]] damage on a critical failure). A creature taking persistent bleed damage from Hasty Traps takes a –5-foot enhancement penalty to its Speed. This occurs to as many creatures as the kobold trap squad has segments when it performed the action, but a single creature can trigger only one trap per turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.JUo3BTRaRHkL9ZBC]{Effect: Hasty Traps}

action->Sling Barrage.name: Sling Barrage
action->Sling Barrage.description: The kobolds draw their slings, then launch a ranged barrage of stones. This barrage is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 50 feet that deals @Damage[3d4[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:18|basic|options:area-effect] save. When the squad is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].

action->Spear Jabs.name: Spear Jabs
action->Spear Jabs.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The kobold trap squad engages in a coordinated melee attack against all enemies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], with a @Check[reflex|dc:18|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d6+4)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(2d6+7)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

Leukodaemon Plague.name: Leukodaemon Plague
Leukodaemon Plague.publicNotes: Daemons are shaped by, and devoted to, the destruction of life in all its forms. Leukodaemons serve the Apocalypse Rider of Pestilence, spreading disease across the Universe with their very touch. A small army of leukodaemons has the potential to wipe out a small country—or more—if left unchecked.

action->Plaguesense.name: Plaguesense
action->Plaguesense.description: A leukodaemon plague senses any creature with a disease, and knows the type and current stage of all diseases carried by any creature within range.

action->Infectious Aura.name: Infectious Aura
action->Infectious Aura.description: 30 feet. Leukodaemons radiate infection. All creatures within 30 feet of a leukodaemon plague take a –2 status penalty to saves against disease. If a creature within range contracts or progresses a disease, all adjacent creatures are exposed to the same disease, at the same DC.

action->Daemonic Pestilence.name: Daemonic Pestilence
action->Daemonic Pestilence.description:
The leukodaemon plague can telepathically communicate with the afflicted creature at any distance on the same plane

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:34]

Stage 1 carrier (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 day)

Stage 4 drained 2 (1 day)

Stage 5 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} (1 week)

Stage 6 dead

action->Infected Jaws and Claws.name: Infected Jaws and Claws
action->Infected Jaws and Claws.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The leukodaemons unleash an onslaught of blows against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] (@Check[reflex|dc:31|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d10+3)[untyped]] damage plus daemonic pestilence

2 @Damage[(3d10+9)[untyped]] damage plus daemonic pestilence

3 @Damage[(4d10+12)[untyped]] damage plus daemonic pestilence

action->Pestilent Wheeze.name: Pestilent Wheeze
action->Pestilent Wheeze.description: The leukodaemons exhale a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of disease-ridden black flies that deal @Damage[5d8[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:31|basic] save). A creature that fails the save also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). When the leukodaemon plague is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:cone|distance:20].

action->Quicken Pestilence.name: Quicken Pestilence
action->Quicken Pestilence.description: The leukodaemons coax a disease into full bloom. They choose a target within their infectious aura that's currently affected by a disease. That creature must attempt a Fortitude save against the disease as if the interval for the disease's current stage had passed.

action->Mass Rejuvenation.name: Mass Rejuvenation
action->Mass Rejuvenation.description: This functions similarly to a lich's rejuvenation ability, though with all the liches of a legion returning as a troop thanks to a collective @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.qFVPeeJ70B1u2n81]{Soul Cage}, which is a level 18 item that has Hardness 15 and 54 Hit Points.

action->Troop Counterspell.name: Troop Counterspell
action->Troop Counterspell.description:
Trigger A creature within the legion's sight casts a spell the legion has prepared

Effect The lich legion expends a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature's casting of that same spell. The lich legion loses the spell slot as if they had cast the triggering spell. The lich legion then attempts to counteract the triggering spell with a +2 status bonus to the counteract check.

action->Siphoning Grip.name: Siphoning Grip
action->Siphoning Grip.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The lich legion touches all enemies within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] to drain their life (@Check[reflex|dc:37|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions. For each action the lich legion uses, the legion gains 10 temporary Hit Points that last 1 minute.

1 @Damage[2d8[void]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(4d8+11)[void]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(6d8+13)[void]|options:area-damage] damage

action->Steady Troop Spellcasting.name: Steady Troop Spellcasting
action->Steady Troop Spellcasting.description:
When the lich legion Casts a Spell, their constituent members combine their efforts into casting a more powerful version of the spell than any one member could achieve alone. When Casting a Spell that has an area of a burst, cone, or line and doesn't have a duration, increase the area of that spell. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius is not affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet long or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

If a reaction would disrupt the lich legion's spellcasting action, the lich legion attempts a @Check[flat|dc:12]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Mitflit Vermin Cavalry.name: Mitflit Vermin Cavalry
Mitflit Vermin Cavalry.publicNotes: Though mitflits are known as cowardly gremlins, they can be urged into an aggressive fervor by the right leader. Mounted on giant ticks, centipedes, and other verminous arthropods, these mitflits overcome their self-loathing to take the fight to their enemies.

action->Crawling Stabs.name: Crawling Stabs
action->Crawling Stabs.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The mitflits thrust with their shortswords, coordinated with bites from their giant vermin mounts. All enemies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:18|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d6+4)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(2d6+8)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

action->Leaping Charge.name: Leaping Charge
action->Leaping Charge.description: The mitflit vermin cavalry Leaps up to 30 feet. If it moves at least 15 feet, the cavalry deals @Damage[(2d6+4)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic|options:area-effect] save) to each enemy within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] at the end of its movement.

action->Mounted Troop.name: Mounted Troop
action->Mounted Troop.description: Effects that target only animals or only humanoids may not work on the mitflit vermin cavalry, subject to the GM's discretion.

action->Vengeful Wrath.name: Vengeful Wrath
action->Vengeful Wrath.description: As long as it's not frightened, the mitflit vermin cavalry gains a +2 status bonus to the DC of its Crawling Stabs ability against creatures that have previously damaged or tormented it.

Monk Cadre.name: Monk Cadre
Monk Cadre.publicNotes: Many martial artists train to defend themselves and their allies against unwanted aggression, but sometimes the circumstances dictate that even the most peaceful monks must go to war. A cadre of studied monks is capable of dishing out great damage with punches and kicks, as well as focusing their qi into ranged blasts.

action->Coordinated Maneuvers.name: Coordinated Maneuvers
action->Coordinated Maneuvers.description: The monk cadre is practiced at putting their foes off-balance. The monks choose [[/act disarm]], [[/act grapple]], [[/act reposition]], or [[/act reposition]] and attempt an Athletics check to perform that action, comparing the result to the appropriate DC (Fortitude for Grapple and Reposition, Reflex for Disarm and Trip) of each enemy within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5]. This can result in a different degree of success for each target.

action->Pummeling Punches.name: Pummeling Punches
action->Pummeling Punches.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The monks perform well-timed coordinated melee attacks against all enemies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], with a @Check[reflex|dc:31|basic|options:area-damage] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[2d8[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(4d8+8)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(4d8+16)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

action->Qi Blast.name: Qi Blast
action->Qi Blast.description: The monks channel their qi into an explosion of energy that affects all creatures in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 60 feet. This explosion deals @Damage[6d6[force]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:31|basic|options:area-damage] save. When the monk cadre is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].

Ofalth Stampede.name: Ofalth Stampede
Ofalth Stampede.publicNotes: If a large city's waste management system spirals out of control, ofalths can grow and propagate unchecked. These reeking creatures haul tons of trash on their backs and carry a particularly virulent disease.
Ofalth Stampede.hpDetails: (4 segments), filth wallow; Thresholds 180 (3 segments), 90 (2 segments)

action->Refuse Pile.name: Refuse Pile
action->Refuse Pile.description: When an ofalth stampede is not in danger, they can spend 1 minute settling into a 20-foot pile that looks like a heap of garbage. Until the next time they take an action, the troop gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC. A creature that enters the area of the garbage heap or interacts with it must attempt a save against the ofalth stampede's stench.

action->Filth Wallow.name: Filth Wallow
action->Filth Wallow.description: A trash stampede gains fast healing 10 when in an area with a high concentration of debris or excrement, such as a refuse heap or sewer.

action->Offal Rain.name: Offal Rain
action->Offal Rain.description: The ofalth stampede hurls a tremendous amount of rotting trash, which rains down in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 60 feet. All creatures in the area take @Damage[4d10[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:33|basic|options:area-effect] save). Creatures that fail the saving throw are also exposed to wretched weeps. When the troop is reduced to 2 segments, the area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].

action->Putrid Pummeling.name: Putrid Pummeling
action->Putrid Pummeling.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The ofalths pummel all enemies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10], with a @Check[reflex|dc:33|basic] save. The damage depends on the number of actions. Creatures that fail the saving throw are exposed to wretched weeps.

1 @Damage[(1d12+3)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(3d12+7)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(4d12+10)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

action->Wretched Weeps.name: Wretched Weeps
action->Wretched Weeps.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:36]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d4[bleed]]{2d4 persistent bleed} every hour and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[bleed]]{2d6 persistent bleed} every hour and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)

Omox Slime Pool.name: Omox Slime Pool
Omox Slime Pool.publicNotes: Omoxes are the embodiment of pollution and filth. While they have no true anatomy, they tend to take on mocking humanoid forms—though this distinction is difficult to spot when omoxes gather in large groups as part of an attacking force. Such a group often looks like a single roiling mass of slime with multiple torsos jutting up in a military formation.

action->Clean Vulnerability.name: Clean Vulnerability
action->Clean Vulnerability.description: Omoxes embody filth, and they find the concept of cleanliness abhorrent. An omox slime pool subjected to an effect that cleans them takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage. They also take this damage the first time each round a creature damaged by an omox slime pool spends actions cleaning off the resultant filth.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Absorb Weapon.name: Absorb Weapon
action->Absorb Weapon.description:
Trigger A creature hits the omox slime pool with a melee weapon

Effect The omoxes attempt to [[/act disarm]] the creature. On a critical success, the weapon becomes subsumed within the body of an omox rather than falling to the ground. Retrieving the weapon requires a successful [[/act disarm dc=45]]{DC 45 Athletics} check to Disarm.

action->Slime Barrage.name: Slime Barrage
action->Slime Barrage.description: The omoxes hurl balls of heavy slime in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 30 feet. All creatures in the area take @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning],2d6[acid]|options:area-damage]{4d6 bludgeoning damage and 2d6 acid damage} (@Check[reflex|dc:35|basic|options:area-effect] save). A creature that fails the save is mired in the slime, taking a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute or until it Escapes ([[/act escape dc=38]]{DC 38}); on a critical failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for the same duration. When the slime pool is reduced to 2 segments, the area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].

action->Smothering Grasp.name: Smothering Grasp
action->Smothering Grasp.description:
Requirements The omox slime pool has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect Omox slime flows onto the creature, completely covering it. The creature must then succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:38] save or it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} and must hold its breath or begin @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.S55aqwWIzpQRFhcq.JournalEntryPage.OiRwxbfLNUniLg15#drowning-and-suffocating]{suffocating}. These effects last as long as the omoxes have the creature grabbed or restrained.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.other-effects.Item.2u26bmArDPuoCljc]{Effect: Remaining Air}

action->Waves of Sludge.name: Waves of Sludge
action->Waves of Sludge.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The omoxes attack all enemies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] with slimy tendrils (@Check[reflex|dc:35|basic] save). A creature that critically fails this saving throw is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the slime pool. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d6+3)[bludgeoning],1d6[acid]|options:area-damage]{1d6+3 bludgeoning damage plus 1d6 acid damage}

2 @Damage[(3d6+12)[bludgeoning],2d6[acid]|options:area-damage]{3d6+12 bludgeoning damage plus 2d6 acid damage}

3 @Damage[(4d6+14)[bludgeoning],3d6[acid]|options:area-damage]{4d6+14 bludgeoning damage plus 3d6 acid damage}

Orc Raiding Party.name: Orc Raiding Party
Orc Raiding Party.publicNotes: Orc raiding parties are feared units whose unrelenting attacks and sheer ferocity make them capable, if not subtle, soldiers. Orc raiders take the duty of carrying their hold's banner into combat with deadly seriousness and will gladly risk grievous injuries to keep their hold's standard flying high.

action->Ferocious Fall.name: Ferocious Fall
action->Ferocious Fall.description:
The orc raiding party is about to lose a segment due to passing a Hit Point threshold

Effect The dying orc raiders lash out as they fall. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] takes @Damage[(1d6+2)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save); this occurs before the raiding party loses a segment.

action->Break Through.name: Break Through
action->Break Through.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The orc raiders exploit a gap in enemy lines. The orc raiding party Strides twice; it can pass through spaces of Medium or smaller creatures but can't end its movement in them. All enemies whose spaces the orc raiding party passed through or were adjacent to at any point during their movement take @Damage[(1d6+2)[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:forced-movement] save). A creature who critically fails this save is also pushed 5 feet away from the orc raiding party. Break Through damages each creature only once.

action->Iron Rain.name: Iron Rain
action->Iron Rain.description: The orc raiders launch a multitude of javelins at foes in a deadly volley. This volley is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 30 feet that deals @Damage[3d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save. When the orc raiding party is reduced to 2 or fewer segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].

action->Rip Them Up.name: Rip Them Up
action->Rip Them Up.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The orc raiders batter all enemies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] with coordinated knuckle dagger strikes (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d6+2)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d6+5)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(3d6+7)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

Protean Tumult.name: Protean Tumult
Protean Tumult.publicNotes: Due to the inherently chaotic nature of proteans, many would assume they are incapable of cooperation. However, they are cunning enough to be able to unite in the face of danger or at the behest of more powerful beings, sometimes acting as a group called a protean tumult. Such an association is comprising of dozens of proteans of different shapes and sizes, many of whom continually alter their forms from moment to moment.

effect->Spell Effect: Unfettered Movemen.name: Spell Effect: Unfettered Movement (Constant)
effect->Spell Effect: Unfettered Movemen.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aqRYNoSvxsVfqglH]{Unfettered Movement}

You ignore circumstance penalties to your Speed.

effect->Effect: Adaptive Strike (Adamant.name: Effect: Adaptive Strike (Adamantine)
effect->Effect: Adaptive Strike (Adamant.description: The creature's melee strikes count either as adamantine, cold iron or silver.

action->Entropy Sense.name: Entropy Sense
action->Entropy Sense.description: A protean tumult can anticipate the most likely presence of a creature through a supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants it the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. Veil of privacy prevents a creature from being detected via entropy sense automatically (without a counteract check).

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Protean Anatomy.name: Protean Anatomy
action->Protean Anatomy.description:
A protean's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the protean takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first. The protean is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the protean automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.c6SiBB3mzV8lZUQr]{Effect: Protean Anatomy}

action->Chaos Flux.name: Chaos Flux
action->Chaos Flux.description: A protean tumult is less organized and more vicious than most troops. It can move into other creatures' spaces, and other creatures can move into its spaces. Its spaces are difficult terrain to non-protean creatures. A creature that willingly moves into a protean tumult's space takes @Damage[(1d12+1)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect] save); a creature takes this damage only once per round.

action->Chaos Strike.name: Chaos Strike
action->Chaos Strike.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The protean tumult chooses adamantine, cold iron, or silver; the damage dealt by its Claws, Jaws, and Tails is treated as that material for 1 minute or until it uses Chaos Strike again.

action->Claws, Jaws, and Tails.name: Claws, Jaws, and Tails
action->Claws, Jaws, and Tails.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The tumult viciously attacks each enemy within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d12+1)[bludgeoning]] damage

2 @Damage[(2d12+10)[bludgeoning]] damage

3 @Damage[(3d12+11)[bludgeoning]] damage

action->Stupefying Swipe.name: Stupefying Swipe
action->Stupefying Swipe.description: The protean tumult makes their way across the battlefield. It Strides. At the end of this movement, they lash out at the enemy with tentacles and other blunt body parts, dealing @Damage[(2d12+10)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect] save). A creature who fails this save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 2 rounds (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} on a critical failure).

Qadiran Camel Corps.name: Qadiran Camel Corps
Qadiran Camel Corps.publicNotes: Navigating the deserts of Golarion requires trained individuals and often specialized mounts to keep them safe. The Qadiran camel corps are one such example of those who embark on long patrols, hunt down brigands, and dispatch any natural threats that might trouble travelers.

action->Desert-Adapted Troop.name: Desert-Adapted Troop
action->Desert-Adapted Troop.description: A camel corps is well-adapted to heat and deserts. They treat environmental heat as if it was one step less severe, and if the camel mounts have eaten and drank their fill, the corps can Subsist for 1 week without needing to attempt Survival checks.

action->Dust Storm.name: Dust Storm
action->Dust Storm.description:
Requirements The camel corps is in a desert or similar region

Effect The camel corps Steps, whipping up sand into a short-lived storm that obscures the surrounding region. Until the end of their next turn, the camel corps is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from all creatures more than 15 feet away, and all creatures more than 15 feet away are concealed to the camel corps.

action->Mounted Troop.name: Mounted Troop
action->Mounted Troop.description: Effects that target only animals or only humanoids may not work on the valkyrie tempest, subject to the GM's discretion.

action->Reflective Arrows.name: Reflective Arrows
action->Reflective Arrows.description:
Adjusting to the angle of the sun, the camel riders draw their shortbows, then launch a ranged attack in the form of an arcing volley. This volley is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 60 feet that deals @Damage[3d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). In areas of bright light, such as outside during the day, the targets take a –1 circumstance penalty to the save. When the camel corps is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.owOGKBjP7tlyQD5o]{Effect: Reflective Arrows (Penalty)}

action->Scimitar Assault.name: Scimitar Assault
action->Scimitar Assault.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The camel corps engages in a coordinated melee attack against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d6+1)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d6+7)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(2d6+11)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

action->Trailblazing Stride.name: Trailblazing Stride
action->Trailblazing Stride.description: While moving on land, the Qadiran camel corps ignores the effects of non-magical difficult terrain.

action->Dirty Tricks.name: Dirty Tricks
action->Dirty Tricks.description: The ratfolk feint and trip up their foes in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], attempting a single @Check[thievery|against:reflex] check and comparing the result to each target's Reflex DC. On a success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} on a critical success) until they take an Interact action to remove the condition.

action->Poisoned Bolts.name: Poisoned Bolts
action->Poisoned Bolts.description: The shank squad draws hand crossbows to fire poisoned bolts in a volley. This volley is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 60 feet that deals @Damage[2d6[piercing],2d6[poison]|options:area-damage]{2d6 piercing damage and 2d6 poison damage} with a @Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect] save. When the shank squad is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].

action->Shank 'Em.name: Shank 'Em
action->Shank 'Em.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The shank squad makes a coordinated attack with shivs and daggers against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], with a @Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d6[slashing],1d4[precision]|options:area-damage]{1d6 slashing damage and 1d4 precision damage}

2 @Damage[(2d6+3)[slashing],2d4[precision]|options:area-damage]{2d6+3 slashing damage and 2d4 precision damage}

3 @Damage[(2d6+6)[slashing],3d4[precision]|options:area-damage]{2d6+6 slashing damage and 3d4 precision damage}

Redcap Brigade.name: Redcap Brigade
Redcap Brigade.publicNotes: Redcaps are sadistic fey known for their merciless bloodlust. When they gather into troops, they goad each other to greater heights of violence.

action->Divine Revulsion.name: Divine Revulsion
action->Divine Revulsion.description:
If a redcap brigade sees a creature brandish a religious symbol of a deity (which requires an Interact action by that creature) or cast a divine spell while wearing a religious symbol, the troop must attempt a @Check[will|dc:26] save. They then become temporarily immune to all brandished religious symbols for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The troop is unaffected.

Success The troop is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The troop is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The troop is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

action->Blood Soak.name: Blood Soak
action->Blood Soak.description:
Trigger The redcap brigade loses its first segment, causes another troop to lose its first segment, or is otherwise exposed to copious amounts of blood

Effect The redcap brigade gains a status bonus to damage rolls for 1 minute. The bonus is +2 if they spend one action on Bloody Reaping, +6 if they spend two actions, or +8 if they spend 3 actions. They gain a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with Bowl Over and Stomp.

action->Bloody Reaping.name: Bloody Reaping
action->Bloody Reaping.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The redcaps in the brigade wildly swing their halberds and sickles at each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10], with a @Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d10+2)[slashing]|options:area-damage,bloody-reaping-one]

2 @Damage[(2d10+9)[slashing]|options:area-damage,bloody-reaping-two]

3 @Damage[(3d10+10)[slashing]|options:area-damage,bloody-reaping-three]

action->Bowl Over and Stomp.name: Bowl Over and Stomp
action->Bowl Over and Stomp.description:
The redcap brigade Strides; they can pass through spaces of Medium or smaller creatures, but can't end their movement in them. All enemies whose spaces the redcap brigade passed through take @Damage[4d8[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage,bowl-ower-and-stomp] damage and must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:26|options:area-effect,inflicts:prone] save. Bowl Over and Stomp damages each creature only once.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage. If it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, it also takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,bleed]] damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage, is knocked prone, and takes @Damage[2d6[persistent,bleed]] damage.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, is knocked prone, and takes @Damage[2d6[persistent,bleed]] damage.

action->Deadly Swipes.name: Deadly Swipes
action->Deadly Swipes.description:
Trigger The redcap brigade drops a creature to 0 Hit Points with Bloody Reaping

Effect The redcap brigade performs an additional one-action Bloody Reaping, ignoring the once per round frequency limitation. This does not deal damage to the triggering creature.

Scamp Avalanche.name: Scamp Avalanche
Scamp Avalanche.publicNotes: In general, all elemental scamps are a bit mischievous, and equally as likely to gather in masses to wreak (often accidental) havoc.

action->Scree Breath.name: Scree Breath
action->Scree Breath.description: The scamp avalanche breathes rocks in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[3d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). The scamp avalanche can't use Scree Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Scree Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Stone Slams.name: Stone Slams
action->Stone Slams.description:
The scamp avalanche attacks with a flurry of tiny slams. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning],1d4[poison]|options:area-damage]{1d6 bludgeoning damage and 1d4 poison damage}

2 @Damage[(2d6+2)[bludgeoning],2d4[poison]|options:area-damage]{2d6+2 bludgeoning damage and 2d4 poison damage}

3 @Damage[(2d6+4)[bludgeoning],3d4[poison]|options:area-damage]{2d6+4 bludgeoning damage and 3d4 poison damage}
