Scamp Flood.publicNotes: In general, all elemental scamps are a bit mischievous, and equally as likely to gather in masses to wreak (often accidental) havoc.

action->Acid Breath.name: Acid Breath
action->Acid Breath.description: The scamp flood breathes acid in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[3d6[acid]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). The scamp flood can't use Acid Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Acid Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Drenching Claws.name: Drenching Claws
action->Drenching Claws.description:
The scamp flood attacks with a flurry of tiny claws. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d6[slashing],1d4[acid]|options:area-damage]{1d6 slashing damage and 1d4 acid damage}

2 @Damage[(2d6+2)[slashing],2d4[acid]|options:area-damage]{2d6+2 slashing damage and 2d4 acid damage}

3 @Damage[(2d6+4)[slashing],3d4[acid]|options:area-damage]{2d6+4 slashing damage and 3d4 acid damage}

Scamp Inferno.name: Scamp Inferno
Scamp Inferno.publicNotes: Fire scamps are playful and excitable pranksters from the Plane of Fire that have little concept of moderation. When they gather into flocks, unintentional arson is the inevitable result.

action->Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
action->Smoke Vision.description: The scamp inferno ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

action->Burning Bites.name: Burning Bites
action->Burning Bites.description:
The scamp inferno attacks with a flurry of tiny teeth and flickering flames. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d6[piercing],1d4[fire]|options:area-damage]{1d6 piercing damage and 1d4 fire damage}

2 @Damage[(2d6+2)[piercing],2d4[fire]|options:area-damage]{2d6+2 piercing damage and 2d4 fire damage}

3 @Damage[(2d6+4)[piercing],3d4[fire]|options:area-damage]{2d6+4 piercing damage and 3d4 fire damage}

action->Flame Breath.name: Flame Breath
action->Flame Breath.description: The scamp inferno breathes flames in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[3d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). Creatures that fail the save also take @Damage[1d6[persistent,fire]|options:area-damage] damage. The scamp inferno can't use Flame Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Flame Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Scamp Shrapnel.name: Scamp Shrapnel
Scamp Shrapnel.publicNotes: In general, all elemental scamps are a bit mischievous, and equally as likely to gather in masses to wreak (often accidental) havoc.

action->Metallic Claws.name: Metallic Claws
action->Metallic Claws.description:
The scamp shrapnel attacks with a flurry of tiny claws. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d6[slashing],1d4[bleed]|options:area-damage]{1d6 slashing damage and 1d4 bleed damage}

2 @Damage[(2d6+2)[slashing],2d4[bleed]|options:area-damage]{2d6+2 slashing damage and 2d4 bleed damage}

action->Shrapnel Breath.name: Shrapnel Breath
action->Shrapnel Breath.description: The scamp shrapnel breathes shrapnel in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[3d6[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). Creatures that fail the save also take @Damage[1d6[bleed]] persistent bleed damage.The scamp shrapnel can't use Shrapnel Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Shrapnel Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Scamp Tangle.name: Scamp Tangle
Scamp Tangle.publicNotes: In general, all elemental scamps are a bit mischievous, and equally as likely to gather in masses to wreak (often accidental) havoc.

action->Pollen Breath.name: Pollen Breath
action->Pollen Breath.description: The scamp tangle breathes pollen in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[3d6[poison]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). The scamp tangle can't use Pollen Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Pollen Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Thorny Claws.name: Thorny Claws
action->Thorny Claws.description:

2 @Damage[(2d6+2)[piercing],2d4[bleed]|options:area-damage]{2d6+2 piercing damage and 2d4 persistent bleed damage}

3 @Damage[(2d6+4)[piercing],3d4[bleed]|options:area-damage]{2d6+4 piercing damage and 3d4 persistent bleed damage}

Scamp Whirlwind.name: Scamp Whirlwind
Scamp Whirlwind.publicNotes: In general, all elemental scamps are a bit mischievous, and equally as likely to gather in masses to wreak (often accidental) havoc.

action->Fog Vision.name: Fog Vision
action->Fog Vision.description: The scamp whirlwind ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from fog.

action->Sirocco Breath.name: Sirocco Breath
action->Sirocco Breath.description: The scamp whirlwind breathes in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[3d6[slashing]|options:area-damage|inflicts:forced-movement] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). Creatures that fail the save also get pushed back by 10 feet. The scamp whirlwind can't use Sirocco Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Sirocco Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Sonic Slams.name: Sonic Slams
action->Sonic Slams.description:
The scamp whirlwind attacks with a flurry of tiny slams. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning],1d4[sonic]|options:area-damage]{1d6 bludgeoning damage and 1d4 sonic damage}

2 @Damage[(2d6+2)[bludgeoning],2d4[sonic]|options:area-damage]{2d6+2 bludgeoning damage and 2d4 sonic damage}

3 @Damage[(2d6+4)[bludgeoning],3d4[sonic]|options:area-damage]{2d6+4 bludgeoning damage and 3d4 sonic damage}

Sinswarm.name: Sinswarm
Sinswarm.publicNotes: Sinspawn, monstrosities of twisted humanoid flesh, were created ages ago by the runelord Alaznist to serve as shock troops. Hateful even toward their own kind, sinspawn usually band together only in small, isolated cults, although powerful beings are occasionally able to coerce greater numbers of these slavering horrors to join forces as uniquely bloodthirsty and destructive mobs.

action->Sin Scent.name: Sin Scent
action->Sin Scent.description: A sinswarm can smell creatures reflecting any one of the seven primary sins as the scent ability. The GM determines which creatures are appropriately sinful.

action->Reactive Attack.name: Reactive Attack
action->Reactive Attack.description:
Trigger A creature within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] of the sinswarm uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The sinswarm lashes out at the triggering creature, dealing @Damage[(2d8+9)[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect] save). If the creature critically fails the save and the trigger was a manipulate action, that action is disrupted.

action->Sinful Assault.name: Sinful Assault
action->Sinful Assault.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The sinswarm makes a coordinated attack against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], with a @Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d8+2)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d8+9)[piercing]|options:area-damage,sinful-bite] damage plus sinful bite

3 @Damage[(3d8+11)[piercing]|options:area-damage,sinful-bite] damage plus sinful bite

action->Sinful Bite.name: Sinful Bite
action->Sinful Bite.description:
A creature bitten by a sinspawn must attempt a @Check[will|dc:28] save as it is assailed by sinful thoughts. The sinswarm can't inflict the same sin effect on multiple targets in the same round until it has inflicted all seven sins at least once.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is sickened 2 and takes one of the following additional effects, chosen by the GM:

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 minute (envy)

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (gluttony)

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for 1 minute (greed)

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute (lust)

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute (pride)

  • –10-foot status penalty to all Speeds for 1 minute (sloth) @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.9Qyu0HN5j6DO8Izc]{Effect: Sinful Bite}

  • drained 1 and enfeebled 1 for 1 minute (wrath)

Skeleton Mob.name: Skeleton Mob
Skeleton Mob.publicNotes: To the morbid, a battlefield is no more than a garden of corpses. Sometimes, either through the magic of a necromancer or through an unfortunate pooling of void energy, these bodies rise up as broken and battered skeletons. While some of these skeletons are far from whole, they can still pose a significant threat.

action->Ossuary Storm.name: Ossuary Storm
action->Ossuary Storm.description: The skeleton mob hurls skulls and fragments of bone in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 30 feet. This attack deals @Damage[3d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). When the skeleton mob is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].

action->Rattling Bones.name: Rattling Bones
action->Rattling Bones.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The skeletons engage using their claws and broken bones to attack each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], with a @Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d4+1)[piercing]] damage

2 @Damage[(2d4+7)[piercing]] damage

3 @Damage[(3d4+10)[piercing]] damage

Vanth Guardian Flock.name: Vanth Guardian Flock
Vanth Guardian Flock.publicNotes: Vanth psychopomps are eternal guardians of the cycle of life and death. When souls are threatened by fiends or other malevolent forces, they gather together to cut the threat down.

action->Reactive Relocation.name: Reactive Relocation
action->Reactive Relocation.description:
Trigger A creature hits the guardian flock with an attack roll

Effect After the attack roll is resolved, the troop pools dimensional magic to rapidly change their position. They cast 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Translocate}, except their range is limited to 40 feet.

action->Guardians' Curse.name: Guardians' Curse
action->Guardians' Curse.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The guardian flock bestows a curse upon all enemies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] by touching them with their scythes. Each affected creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:33|options:area-effect] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Guardians' Curse for 24 hours.

Success The target feels a momentary shudder of doom and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute by the distracting sensation.

Failure The target becomes morose and glum as it accepts its own inevitable fate. For 1 hour, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}. Each time the target gains the dying condition, the stupefied condition value increases by 1, to a maximum value of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4}.

Critical Failure As failure, but the effect is permanent.

action->Harvest the Wicked.name: Harvest the Wicked
action->Harvest the Wicked.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The vanths swing their scythes in a coordinated melee attack. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:30|basic] save. The damage depends on the number of actions. The slashing damage is treated as adamantine, cold iron, and silver.

1 @Damage[(1d10+1)[slashing],1d6[untyped]|options:area-damage,item:rune:property:ghost-touch]{1d10+1 slashing damage plus 1d6 shepherd's touch}

2 @Damage[(2d10+3)[slashing],3d6[untyped]|options:area-damage,item:rune:property:ghost-touch]{2d10+3 slashing damage plus 3d6 shepherd's touch}

3 @Damage[(2d10+7)[slashing],4d6[untyped]|options:area-damage,item:rune:property:ghost-touch]{2d10+7 slashing damage plus 4d6 shepherd's touch}

action->Shepherd\u2019s Touch.name: Shepherd’s Touch
action->Shepherd\u2019s Touch.description: The physical damage dealt by the guardian flock's Harvest the Wicked ability is treated as coming from a weapon with a ghost touch property rune. In addition, the vanths deal the listed damage as void damage to living creatures or vitality damage to undead.

Viking Guard.name: Viking Guard
Viking Guard.publicNotes: Battle-tested Ulfen barbarians, hunters, and warriors gather into an elite fighting unit who specialize in offering protection to their leaders in battle as well as protecting those who can afford their services. Traveling far and wide, single troops or entire companies can easily find work based on their reputations, from serving as bodyguards in small private armies to taking on specialized jobs.

action->Sacrifice.name: Sacrifice
action->Sacrifice.description:
Requirements The viking guard has a charge, and that creature is adjacent to the viking guard

Trigger The viking guard's charge takes Hit Point damage

Effect The viking guard's charge takes half damage, and the viking guard takes the remainder of the damage.

action->Berserker Strikes.name: Berserker Strikes
action->Berserker Strikes.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Battle axes in hand, the viking guard engages in a coordinated melee attack against enemies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], with a @Check[reflex|dc:27|basic] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d8+3)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d8+12)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(3d8+15)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

action->Guard Charge.name: Guard Charge
action->Guard Charge.description:
The viking guard designates an ally it can see to be its charge. The charge gains a +2 circumstance bonus to their AC, Reflex saves, and saves against fear when they are adjacent to the viking guard. Further, this allows the viking guard to use its Sacrifice and Shield Wall actions. A viking guard can have only one charge at a time, and if it designates a new charge, the old one loses all benefits. If the viking guard's charge is reduced to 0 Hit Points, the viking guard must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:30] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}; this is an emotion, fear, and mental effect.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.qTbVcHLfFDuyJTTG]{Effect: Guard Charge}

action->Shield Wall.name: Shield Wall
action->Shield Wall.description:
Requirements The viking guard has a charge, and that creature is adjacent to the viking guard

Effect Raising shields, the viking guard Strides up to twice its Speed as it protects its charge. The viking guard gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its AC against reactions triggered by this movement. The viking guard's charge can Stride the same distance as a reaction, moving with the troop to maintain the bonuses from Guard Charge during this movement.

Vordine Legion.name: Vordine Legion
Vordine Legion.publicNotes: Vordines are the foot soldiers of Hell, dispatched in vast armies from the iron city of Dis to guard Hell's uppermost layers and crush the enemies of the archdevils who rule there. Indefatigable and pitiless, a legion of vordines strikes with a ruthless precision that commands fear and envy throughout the multiverse in equal measure. Although they usually serve at the command of more powerful devils, such as the tyrannical nessari, every legion also observes a unique internal hierarchy that enables another vordine to assume command at a moment's notice should it become necessary.

action->Reactive Attack.name: Reactive Attack
action->Reactive Attack.description:
Trigger A creature within the vordine legion's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The creature takes @Damage[(2d8+11)[piercing]|options:area-damage|traits:magical,unholy] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect] save); this damage has the magical and unholy traits. If the creature critically fails its saving throw and the trigger was a manipulate action, the legion disrupts that action.

action->Burning March.name: Burning March
action->Burning March.description: The vordine legion Strides, leaving an orderly pattern of burning hoofprints in each square they enter. The hoofprints continue to burn for 1 minute. Any creature on the ground that begins its turn in, or enters a square with, burning hoofprints takes @Damage[2d8[fire]] damage.

action->Impaling Barrage.name: Impaling Barrage
action->Impaling Barrage.description: The vordine legion releases a hail of tridents. This hail is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 40 feet that deals @Damage[4d8[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect] save). Creatures that fail the saving throw are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until the start of the vordine legion's next turn (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} on a critical failure). When the vordines are reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].

action->Tines of Dis.name: Tines of Dis
action->Tines of Dis.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The vordines of the legion make coordinated melee attacks with their tridents. Each enemy within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d8+2)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

Wight Battalion.name: Wight Battalion
Wight Battalion.publicNotes: Wights are malevolent undead, bent on desecrating the holy and determined to cause suffering to all living creatures. A lone wight is dangerous enough, but when compelled to act together, they are a force to be reckoned with. A wight battalion has the potential to curse entire armies, increasing their numbers until they become an unholy tide.

action->Final Grudge.name: Final Grudge
action->Final Grudge.description:
Trigger The wight battalion is about to lose a segment due to Hit Point damage

Effect The wights strike out as they fall. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] takes @Damage[2d4[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect] save). This occurs before the battalion loses a segment.

action->Fueled by Spite.name: Fueled by Spite
action->Fueled by Spite.description:
Each time a creature loses Hit Points due to the wight battalion's corrupting spite curse, the battalion gains 6 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.yeK8zmBJvam75Fp7]{Effect: Fueled by Spite}

action->Corrupting Spite.name: Corrupting Spite
action->Corrupting Spite.description:
The wight battalion's attacks inflict a curse that makes a creature grow weak and spiteful. A living humanoid that dies while under this curse rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.DBTbqI9QQRtlJwWh]{Wight} after [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, controlled by the wight battalion that inflicted the curse. This new wight can't inflict corrupting spite and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}. If the creating wight battalion dies or after roughly a month of existence, the new wight becomes autonomous and becomes a normal wight

action->Hateful Daggers.name: Hateful Daggers
action->Hateful Daggers.description:
The wights coordinate melee attacks with the daggers they were buried with. Each enemy within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] attempts a @Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save. The damage depends on the number of actions. On a failed save, the creature is also exposed to corrupting spite.

Wolf Pack.name: Wolf Pack
Wolf Pack.publicNotes: Though wolf packs can be a menace to farming communities that rely on livestock, they prefer not to go after humanoids or other dangerous foes. However, hungry packs don't have the luxury of being cautious.

action->Harry Prey.name: Harry Prey
action->Harry Prey.description: The wolf pack focuses all their efforts on biting a single adjacent foe, who takes @Damage[(4d6+8)[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save). If the creature fails this saving throw, the wolf pack can immediately attempt an [[/act trip]]{Athletics} check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} the creature.

action->Pack Hunt.name: Pack Hunt
action->Pack Hunt.description:
The wolves work together to fell their opponents. Each enemy within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] attempts a @Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save. A creature who is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for this attack. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d6+1)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d6+7)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(2d6+11)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

Xulgath Army.name: Xulgath Army
Xulgath Army.publicNotes: Though most xulgath settlements can be found in the Darklands, these reptilian humanoids sometimes venture to the surface with ill intent. When gathered into an army, xulgaths tear through innocent communities in the name of whatever leader they serve.

action->Club Offensive.description:
Frequency once per round

action->Rend Flesh.name: Rend Flesh
action->Rend Flesh.description: The xulgaths concentrate their attacks on a single adjacent enemy, clawing and biting with abandon. That creature takes @Damage[(3d4+5)[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save). On a failed save, the creature also takes @Damage[1d4[persistent,bleed]] damage.

Xulgath Dinosaur Cavalry.name: Xulgath Dinosaur Cavalry
Xulgath Dinosaur Cavalry.publicNotes: Xulgaths have been breeding and training dinosaurs for millennia, and the bonds between them are as familiar and strong as that between any other humanoid and their domesticated companion of choice. While most of the creatures are used primarily as beasts of burden, elite xulgath soldiers known as roughriders train the most vicious and aggressive dinosaurs from numerous species to serve as vicious and terrifying mounts, capable of punching through defensive lines and smashing fortifications to splinters as easily as they scatter enemy soldiers.

action->Javelin Barrage.name: Javelin Barrage
action->Javelin Barrage.description: The xulgaths draw javelins and launch a coordinated barrage at range. This barrage is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 30 feet that deals @Damage[4d8[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic|options:area-effect] save). When the cavalry is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].

action->Mounted Troop.name: Mounted Troop
action->Mounted Troop.description: Effects that target only animals or only humanoids may not work on the valkyrie tempest, subject to the GM's discretion.

action->Spears, Teeth, and Horns.description:
Frequency once per round

Zecui Horde.name: Zecui Horde
Zecui Horde.publicNotes: A surprise raid by a swarm of the insectile zecui can easily wipe out an entire village overnight. When they don't devour their victims immediately, zecuis typically implant them with their own larvae and bury them in sprawling mass graves, where the developing zecui horde can lie dormant for years before suddenly erupting to the surface to wreak havoc on nearby settlements.

action->Harden Chitin.name: Harden Chitin
action->Harden Chitin.description: The zecuis fuse their chitin into black metallic shells. The horde gains resistance 10 to all damage (except mental and spirit) until they next take a move action.

action->Mandible Frenzy.name: Mandible Frenzy
action->Mandible Frenzy.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The horde makes a vicious bite attack against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage dealt depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d8+2)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d8+12)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(3d8+15)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

action->Mucus Deluge.name: Mucus Deluge
action->Mucus Deluge.description: The horde spits a volley of larva-infested mucus as a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 30 feet. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:27|options:area-effect,inflicts:immobilized] save or be stuck to the nearest surface, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until they @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} ([[/act escape dc=30]]{DC 30}). Any creature so immobilized is exposed to zecui larvae at the end of each of its turns. When the zecui horde is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].

action->Subterranean Ambush.name: Subterranean Ambush
action->Subterranean Ambush.description:
Requirements The zecui horde has burrowed into an ambush position just beneath a surface of dirt, sand, or a similar loose material

Effect The horde bursts from the ground and moves up to its Speed. The horde deals @Damage[(1d8+2)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect] save) to each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] at the end of this movement.

action->Zecui Larvae.name: Zecui Larvae
action->Zecui Larvae.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:30]

Stage 1 visible lumps as the larvae move but no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 day)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} and controlled by the zecui larva (1 day)

Stage 5 the creature dies and an adult @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.vVs0N3mcWYHsyccc]{Zecui} can emerge from the corpse as an Interact action.
